Title: Recent trends of digital twin technologies in the energy sector: A comprehensive review
Authors: C. Ghenai, Lama Al Haj Husein, Marwa Al Nahlawi, A. Hamid, M. Bettayeb
Abstract summary: The paper reviews the use of digital twin technologies in the energy sector, but does not specifically address methodological issues in digital twin evaluation for human-AI interaction.

Title: A comprehensive review of the dynamic applications of the digital twin technology across diverse energy sectors
Authors: Firas Basim Ismail, Hussein Al-Faiz, H. Hasini, Ammar F. J. Al-Bazi, Hussein A. Kazem
Abstract summary: This paper provides a comprehensive review of the applications of digital twin technology across diverse energy sectors.

Title: Exploring the Application of Digital Twin Technology in the Energy Sector using MEREC and MAIRCA Methods
Authors: Asmaa Elsayed, Bilal Arain, Karam M. Sallam
Abstract summary: The paper explores the application of digital twin technology in the energy sector, using MEREC and MAIRCA methods to evaluate and prioritize criteria for decision-making.

Title: Digital Twins in Human-Computer Interaction: A Systematic Review
Venue: International journal of human computer interactions
Abstract summary: The paper reviews how Digital Twins are described in Human-Computer Interaction literature, but does not specifically address methodological issues in the energy sector.

Title: Household Digital Twin to Support Energy Management and Smart Appliance Research
Venue: IEEE International Conference on Smart Grid Communications
Abstract summary: The paper presents a digital twin approach to evaluate energy management algorithms and smart appliance features in the energy sector.

Title: A Theoretical Open Architecture Framework and Technology Stack for Digital Twins in Energy Sector Applications
Authors: S. Gourisetti, S. Bhadra, D. Sebastian-Cardenas, Md Touhiduzzaman, Osman Ahmed
Abstract summary: This paper proposes a digital twin open architecture framework and technology stack for the energy sector to address challenges in real-world scalable deployment.

Title: Digital Twin Application to Energy Consumption Management in Production: A Literature Review
Authors: Daniel R Perossa, R. F. B. Santacruz, R. Rocca, L. Fumagalli
Abstract summary: This paper reviews the application of digital twins to energy consumption management in production, including the human role and interaction.

Title: A Survey of Digital Twin Techniques in Smart Manufacturing and Management of Energy Applications
Authors: Yujie Wang, Xu Kang, Zonghai Chen
Abstract summary: This paper reviews digital twin approaches and their potential applications in the energy sector, but does not specifically address methodological issues in digital twin evaluation for human-AI interaction.
